Installation

Before you can use TEFLoN2 , you will need to install its dependencies. TEFLoN2 uses Python 3, BWA (Burrows-Wheeler Alignment Tool), Samtools, RepeatMasker and SnakeMake.

TEFLoN2

TEFLON2 is installed on Github repository or your console:

$ sudo apt update
$ sudo apt install git
$ git clone https://github.com/asfistonlavie/TEFLoN2.git

Dependencies

  • Python ≥ 3

  • BWA ≥ 0.7.17

  • SAMtools ≥ 1.15

  • RepeatMasker ≥ 4.1.2

  • Snakemake ≥ 7.7.0

  • SingularityCE 3.11.0

Using SingularityCE

For install SingularityCE, follow installation instructions on SingularityCE site.

A Singularity container is available with all tools compiled in. The Singularity file provided in this repo and can be compiled as such:

$ sudo singularity build TEFLoN.simg Singularity

if you can’t use sudo :

singularity build --fakeroot TEFLoN.simg Singularity

Manually

For manual installation, it is best to go directly to the tool documentation.

Python 3

To check the version of your python :

$ python --version

If python < 3, install python 3 on their site or your console:

$ sudo apt update
$ sudo apt install python3

If all went well you now have python 3 on your computer.

Burrows-Wheeler Alignment Tool (BWA)

If your computer has bwa installed, check the version of your bwa :

$ bwa

If bwa is not installed or version < 0.7.17 :

$ sudo apt update
sudo apt -y install bwa

Recheck bwa version and if there are any problems, go to the bwa site.

SAMtools

If your computer has SAMtools installed, check the version of your SAMtools :

$ samtools --version

If samtools is not installed or SAMtools < 1.15, follow installation instructions on samtools site.

RepeatMasker

For install RepeatMasker, follow installation instructions on RepeatMasker site.

SnakeMake

If your computer has SnakeMake installed, check the version of your SnakeMake :

$ snakemake --version

If SnakeMake is not installed or version < 7.7.0, follow installation instruction on SnakeMake site.
